org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.song

Class Song

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.song.Song
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Song>, javafx.beans.Observable, FileWrapper

    public class Song
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Song>, javafx.beans.Observable, FileWrapper
    Represents a song, which wraps an .mp3 file on the disk and expose its tags.

    This class implements the Observable interface which makes it easy to be listened for changes to the tags.

      boolean overwriteCover(org.jaudiotagger.tag.images.Artwork cover, boolean commit)
      Overwrite the song's cover and optionally commits the change to the file (it may be useful to use 'false' for the commit parameter when multiple overwrite have to be made to the songs and not only to the tags (e.g.
      boolean overwriteTags(java.util.Map<org.jaudiotagger.tag.FieldKey,java.lang.String> tags, boolean commit)
      Writes a bunch of tags to the underlying file of this song and optionally commit those to the file (it may be useful to use 'false' for the commit parameter when multiple overwrite have to be made to the songs and not only to the tags (e.g. overwrite both the tags and the cover) and the commit have to be done only once).
      boolean overwriteTagsAndCover(java.util.Map<org.jaudiotagger.tag.FieldKey,java.lang.String> tags, org.jaudiotagger.tag.images.Artwork cover, boolean commit)
      Overwrite both the song's cover and its tags, and optionally commits the change to the file (it may be useful to use 'false' for the commit parameter when multiple overwrite have to be made to the songs and not only to the tags (e.g. overwrite both the tags and the cover) and the commit have to be done only once).
      void removeListener(javafx.beans.InvalidationListener listener)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Song

        public Song(java.io.File file,
            boolean loadTags)
        Creates a song for the given underling file and optionally load its tags synchronously.

        The tags can be alternatively via loadTags().

        Parameters:
        file - the song file
        loadTags - whether the tags should be loaded synchronously
        See Also:
        Song(File)

      • Song

        public Song(java.io.File file)
        Creates a song for the given underlying file without load the tags.

        The tags can be loaded via loadTags().

        Parameters:
        file - the song file
        See Also:
        Song(File, boolean)

      • overwriteTags

        public boolean overwriteTags(java.util.Map<org.jaudiotagger.tag.FieldKey,java.lang.String> tags,
                             boolean commit)
        Writes a bunch of tags to the underlying file of this song and optionally commit those to the file (it may be useful to use 'false' for the commit parameter when multiple overwrite have to be made to the songs and not only to the tags (e.g. overwrite both the tags and the cover) and the commit have to be done only once).
        Parameters:
        tags - the tags to overwrite and their values
        commit - whether the changes have to be committed with this overwrite
        Returns:
        false if the tags commit has been requested and failed
        See Also:
        overwriteCover(Artwork, boolean), overwriteTagsAndCover(Map, Artwork, boolean)

      • overwriteCover

        public boolean overwriteCover(org.jaudiotagger.tag.images.Artwork cover,
                              boolean commit)
        Overwrite the song's cover and optionally commits the change to the file (it may be useful to use 'false' for the commit parameter when multiple overwrite have to be made to the songs and not only to the tags (e.g. overwrite both the tags and the cover) and the commit have to be done only once).
        Parameters:
        cover - the new cover for the song
        commit - whether the changes have to be committed with this overwrite
        Returns:
        false if the tags commit has been requested and failed
        See Also:
        overwriteTags(Map, boolean), overwriteTagsAndCover(Map, Artwork, boolean)

      • overwriteTagsAndCover

        public boolean overwriteTagsAndCover(java.util.Map<org.jaudiotagger.tag.FieldKey,java.lang.String> tags,
                                     org.jaudiotagger.tag.images.Artwork cover,
                                     boolean commit)
        Overwrite both the song's cover and its tags, and optionally commits the change to the file (it may be useful to use 'false' for the commit parameter when multiple overwrite have to be made to the songs and not only to the tags (e.g. overwrite both the tags and the cover) and the commit have to be done only once).
        Parameters:
        tags - the tags to overwrite and their values
        cover - the new cover for the song
        commit - whether the changes have to be committed with this overwrite
        Returns:
        false if the tags commit has been requested and failed

      • loadTags

        public void loadTags()
        Loads the tags of the song from the underlying file (which must be an .mp3 file).

      • commitTags

        public boolean commitTags()
        Commits the changes to the tags (update via a method like overwriteTags(Map, boolean)) and thus actually save those to the underlying file.

        This action cause this song to notify its listeners about the change by calling InvalidationListener.invalidated(Observable).

        Returns:
        true if the tags have been saved
